items.title: Trump claims world ‘richer, safer’ than year ago at launch of his ‘board of peace’
items.standfirst: US president holds signing ceremony at World Economic Forum amid concerns new body seeks to replace UNDonald Trump has claimed the world is “richer, safer and much more peaceful than it was just one year ago” as he hosted a launch event for his “board of peace” initiative at the World Economic Forum in Davos.At a signing ceremony for the new organisation, the US president said it would be “one of the most consequential bodies ever created in the history of the world”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president holds signing ceremony at World Economic Forum amid concerns new body seeks to replace UNDonald Trump has claimed the world is “richer, safer and much more peaceful than it was just one year ago” as he hosted a launch event for his “board of peace” initiative at the World Economic Forum in Davos.At a signing ceremony for the new organisation, the US president said it would be “one of the most consequential bodies ever created in the history of the world”. Continue reading...

items.title: Zelenskyy on latest talks with Trump as hopes rise for an end to the Russia-Ukraine war
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and spoke about his latest conversations with President Trump about a potential end to the Russia-Ukraine war. CBS News' Natalie Brand reports.

items.title: French navy intercepts suspected Russian ‘shadow fleet’ tanker in Mediterranean
items.standfirst: Emmanuel Macron says the oil tanker was boarded and searched ‘subject to international sanctions’ The French navy has intercepted a Russian tanker in the Mediterranean suspected to be part of the “shadow fleet” that enables Russia to export oil despite sanctions.“This morning, the French navy boarded and searched an oil tanker from Russia, subject to international sanctions and suspected of flying a false flag,” President Emmanuel Macron said on X. Continue reading...
items.content: Emmanuel Macron says the oil tanker was boarded and searched ‘subject to international sanctions’ The French navy has intercepted a Russian tanker in the Mediterranean suspected to be part of the “shadow fleet” that enables Russia to export oil despite sanctions.“This morning, the French navy boarded and searched an oil tanker from Russia, subject to international sanctions and suspected of flying a false flag,” President Emmanuel Macron said on X. Continue reading...

items.title: Zelensky says US 'security guarantees' for Ukraine ready after meeting with Trump
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Thursday he and US President Donald Trump had agreed on post-war US security guarantees for Ukraine, without providing further details. The deal, which awaits signatures and parliamentary approval, would be a key step in plans to end the Russian invasion.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Thursday he and US President Donald Trump had agreed on post-war US security guarantees for Ukraine, without providing further details. The deal, which awaits signatures and parliamentary approval, would be a key step in plans to end the Russian invasion.

items.title: 'We will let nothing pass': France intercepts Russia-linked oil tanker in Mediterranean
items.standfirst: France’s navy on Thursday intercepted an oil tanker suspected of belonging to Russia’s sanctioned "shadow fleet" in the Mediterranean Sea. French President Emmanuel Macron said the operation, which took place between Spain and Morocco, was carried out with the help of several allies.
items.content: France’s navy on Thursday intercepted an oil tanker suspected of belonging to Russia’s sanctioned "shadow fleet" in the Mediterranean Sea. French President Emmanuel Macron said the operation, which took place between Spain and Morocco, was carried out with the help of several allies.

items.title: Key US allies keep their distance as Trump launches 'Board of Peace' initiative for Gaza
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Thursday unveiled a new US-led "Board of Peace" to oversee the Israel-Hamas ceasefire and shape Gaza’s future, pitching it as a potential rival to the UN – even as several close US allies declined to take part.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday unveiled a new US-led "Board of Peace" to oversee the Israel-Hamas ceasefire and shape Gaza’s future, pitching it as a potential rival to the UN – even as several close US allies declined to take part.

items.title: Ukraine's Zelensky laments EU lack of 'political will' in dealing with Russia
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday criticised what he called the EU’s lack of “political will” towards his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin at Davos. Meanwhile, Denmark said NATO chief Mark Rutte could not negotiate over Greenland after the head of the transatlantic alliance discussed a “framework” for the island's future with US President Donald Trump. France24 journalist Angela Diffley tells us more.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday criticised what he called the EU’s lack of “political will” towards his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin at Davos. Meanwhile, Denmark said NATO chief Mark Rutte could not negotiate over Greenland after the head of the transatlantic alliance discussed a “framework” for the island's future with US President Donald Trump. France24 journalist Angela Diffley tells us more.

items.title: Trump: Board of Peace could be ‘most consequential bodies ever created’
items.standfirst: During the first meeting of the “Board of Peace” at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, President Trump said it could be “one of the most consequential bodies ever created.” Trump added that he is honored to serve as the board’s chairman.
items.content: During the first meeting of the “Board of Peace” at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, President Trump said it could be “one of the most consequential bodies ever created.” Trump added that he is honored to serve as the board’s chairman.

items.title: Who's on Trump's Board of Peace - and who said no

items.content: Sinners received a record number of nods. Clockwise from top left: Michael B. Jordan in Sinners, Wagner Moura in The Secret Agent, Brad Pitt in F1 and Teyana Taylor in One Battle After Another.'/>Sinners landed a record number of nods, while Avatar: Fire and Ash and Wicked: For Good fell short of their franchise predecessors.

items.title: Vampire horror 'Sinners' leads Oscar nominees, followed by 'One Battle After Another'
items.standfirst: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences have announced the nominees for the 98th Academy Awards, with Ryan Coogler's vampire horror "Sinners" leading the charge. Racking up a record 16 nominations in various categories, "Sinners" is followed by Paul Thomas Anderson's "One Battle After Another", on 13 nominations. FRANCE 24's Olivia Salazar-Winspear takes us through the movies and the movie stars who could be in line for a gold statuette on March 15.
items.content: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences have announced the nominees for the 98th Academy Awards, with Ryan Coogler's vampire horror "Sinners" leading the charge. Racking up a record 16 nominations in various categories, "Sinners" is followed by Paul Thomas Anderson's "One Battle After Another", on 13 nominations. FRANCE 24's Olivia Salazar-Winspear takes us through the movies and the movie stars who could be in line for a gold statuette on March 15.

items.title: Trump sues JPMorgan Chase and Jamie Dimon for at least $5bn
items.standfirst: US president alleges JPMorgan stopped offering him banking services in wake of January 6 Capitol riotDonald Trump has sued JPMorgan Chase and its CEO, Jamie Dimon, for at least $5bn after accusing America’s largest bank of “debanking” him.The US president alleged that JPMorgan stopped offering him banking services in the wake of the Capitol riot on January 6, 2021. Earlier this month, he claimed it had “incorrectly and inappropriately” discriminated against him. Continue reading...

items.title: Jack Smith says Donald Trump is ‘person most responsible’ for January 6 Capitol riot during House testimony – US politics live
items.standfirst: Former special counsel says he opted not to charge president with insurrection as he gives evidence during tense hearing about investigationsJack Smith testifies evidence showed Trump crimes in 2020 election effortThe committee is taking a recess for members to vote on the House floor. A reminder that today we’re expecting a vote on Department of Homeland Security funding bill that dozens of Democrats have vowed to vote against.The top Democrat on the House judiciary committee, Jamie Raskin, praised Jack Smith’s handling of his investigations into the president. Raskin also noted the persistent denigration by Donald Trump as Smith conducted the probes. Continue reading...
items.content: Former special counsel says he opted not to charge president with insurrection as he gives evidence during tense hearing about investigationsJack Smith testifies evidence showed Trump crimes in 2020 election effortThe committee is taking a recess for members to vote on the House floor. A reminder that today we’re expecting a vote on Department of Homeland Security funding bill that dozens of Democrats have vowed to vote against.The top Democrat on the House judiciary committee, Jamie Raskin, praised Jack Smith’s handling of his investigations into the president. Raskin also noted the persistent denigration by Donald Trump as Smith conducted the probes. Continue reading...

items.title: Watch: Rep. Jayapal questions Jack Smith about Trump election interference case
items.standfirst: Democratic Rep. Pramila Jayapal asked former special counsel Jack Smith a series of questions about his election interference case against President Trump, including whether the president pressured state officials to ignore vote counts in those states.
items.content: Democratic Rep. Pramila Jayapal asked former special counsel Jack Smith a series of questions about his election interference case against President Trump, including whether the president pressured state officials to ignore vote counts in those states.

items.title: Watch: Jack Smith tells Rep. Swalwell "I was shocked" seeing the Jan. 6 attack unfold
items.standfirst: Former special counsel Jack Smith said he was shocked seeing the Jan. 6, 2021, attack unfold. Earlier in the questioning, Smith told Democratic Rep. Eric Swalwell that his investigation found President Trump "was the most responsible for what happened on January 6. He caused what happened."
items.content: Former special counsel Jack Smith said he was shocked seeing the Jan. 6, 2021, attack unfold. Earlier in the questioning, Smith told Democratic Rep. Eric Swalwell that his investigation found President Trump "was the most responsible for what happened on January 6. He caused what happened."

items.title: Mahindra CEO on Expansion Plans and EV Strategy
items.standfirst: Anish Shah, CEO of Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd., says the company is looking to strengthen its presence in the Australian and South African markets. He added that the second phase of expansion for the group’s passenger vehicle business will be either in Southeast Asia or Europe. Shah speaks with Bloomberg’s Haslinda Amin on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Anish Shah, CEO of Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd., says the company is looking to strengthen its presence in the Australian and South African markets. He added that the second phase of expansion for the group’s passenger vehicle business will be either in Southeast Asia or Europe. Shah speaks with Bloomberg’s Haslinda Amin on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Musk Says It May Be Possible to Reverse Ageing
items.standfirst: Elon Musk says it's highly likely that "we will figure out ways to extend life and maybe even reverse ageing." He speaks with BlackRock CEO Larry Fink at the World Economic Forum in Davos. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Elon Musk says it's highly likely that "we will figure out ways to extend life and maybe even reverse ageing." He speaks with BlackRock CEO Larry Fink at the World Economic Forum in Davos. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Musk Says Everyone on Earth Will Have a Robot
items.standfirst: Elon Musk says everyone on Earth will have a robot some day and they can elevate our standard of living. He speaks with BlackRock CEO Larry Fink at the World Economic Forum in Davos. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Elon Musk says everyone on Earth will have a robot some day and they can elevate our standard of living. He speaks with BlackRock CEO Larry Fink at the World Economic Forum in Davos. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Moderna CEO Says Vaccine Scrutiny Curbing Trials
items.standfirst: Moderna CEO Stephane Bancel says the company does not plan to invest in late-stage vaccine trials because of growing scrutiny of immunizations from US officials. He speaks with Lisa Abramowicz at the annual World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Moderna CEO Stephane Bancel says the company does not plan to invest in late-stage vaccine trials because of growing scrutiny of immunizations from US officials. He speaks with Lisa Abramowicz at the annual World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: BlackRock’s Fink Believes There’s No Bubble Forming in AI Space
items.standfirst: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink says he "sincerely believes" there is no AI bubble. He talks about his support for AI and says there are no formal plans to move Davos to Detroit. He speaks with Bloomberg's Francine Lacqua on the sidelines of the 2026 World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Nasdaq CEO Adena Friedman on AI Transformation, Reforms
items.standfirst: Nasdaq Chair and CEO Adena Friedman speaks to Bloomberg Surveillance on the sidelines of the 2026 World Economic Forum in Davos. items.title: Donald Trump retreats on Greenland threats
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump announced Wednesday that he was scrapping his planned tariffs on eight European nations in an effort to force U.S. control over Greenland, pulling a dramatic reversal shortly after insisting he wanted to get the island “including right, title and ownership.”

clusters.title: A Wikipedia Group Made a Guide to Detect AI Writing. Now a Plug-In Uses It to ‘Humanize’ Chatbots
clusters.neutral_headline: A Wikipedia Group Made a Guide to Detect AI Writing. Now a...

items.title: A Wikipedia Group Made a Guide to Detect AI Writing. Now a Plug-In Uses It to ‘Humanize’ Chatbots
items.standfirst: The web’s best resource for spotting AI writing has ironically become a manual for AI models to hide it.
items.content: The web’s best resource for spotting AI writing has ironically become a manual for AI models to hide it.

items.title: Wikipedia volunteers spent years cataloging AI tells. Now there's a plugin to avoid them.
items.standfirst: The web's best guide to spotting AI writing has become a manual for hiding it.
items.content: On Saturday, tech entrepreneur Siqi Chen released an open source plugin for Anthropic's Claude Code AI assistant that instructs the AI model to stop writing like an AI model. Called "Humanizer," the simple prompt plugin feeds Claude a list of 24 language and formatting patterns that Wikipedia editors have listed as chatbot giveaways. Chen published the plugin on GitHub, where it has picked up over 1,600 stars as of Monday. "It's really handy that Wikipedia went and collated a detailed list of 'signs of AI writing,'" Chen wrote on X. "So much so that you can just tell your LLM to... not do that." The source material is a guide from WikiProject AI Cleanup, a group of Wikipedia editors who have been hunting AI-generated articles since late 2023. French Wikipedia editor Ilyas Lebleu founded the project. The volunteers have tagged over 500 articles for review and, in August 2025, published a formal list of the patterns they kept seeing.Read full article Comments
